B. Counter Arguments
1. Changing how you see social media can help reduce feelings of guilt and pressure.
a. Provide research or case studies to support this statement, and consider offering specific suggestions on how to change one's perspective on social media.
2. Surrounding yourself in a positive environment will have a major impact on your mindset.
a. Offer examples of how a positive environment can influence an individual's happiness and provide research or case studies to support the statement.

IV. A person can create his or her own happiness by intentionally engaging in activities and training their minds.
A. Expand on the concession: Discuss the influence of genetic predispositions on happiness, and consider how some individuals may struggle to overcome these factors.
B. Counter Arguments
1. Training the mind to be happy can be an effective way to increase overall wellbeing.
a. Provide examples or research on specific mental training techniques and their effectiveness in promoting happiness.
2. Intentional activity can help people gain happiness.
a. Offer a more detailed explanation of intentional activities, and provide examples or case studies demonstrating their role in promoting happiness.

V. Happy people choose to have a purposeful life.
A. Expand on the concession: Explain why having a purposeful life does not always guarantee happiness and provide examples to support this statement.
